item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
Ok ill just say what iv heard is the item.
20% chance to not be bingoed on a Successful bingo, Hides items during bingoes.
How to get-Bingo a certain KaijuKage (Like the certain top 10 player for trade) at midnight

Now that's what iv heard. According to the page it doesn't loop….now if that's the case is it really worth he trouble unless you can get it without fail? It it really doesn't loop i have no need to get it. It was nerf'd meaning the effect is hide items and chance of failing. If it loops its worth it by far, however it still is extremely hard to get. How many KaijuKage are there now??? The answer to that wold be 37+ and counting since there are villages planning to blow soon.

Now i dont know if thats the correct info thats what iv collectedly gathered. The info obviously wasnt meant to not be leaked. I mean come on. The people he told probably are able to meet him in person. There are a lot of people that play this game that ither live in Rochester or go to RIT. Everyone is making it seem like a big deal since its supposedly leaked. If someone was told by masters not to tell who in there right mind woul defy him and tell? Thats bannage or getting yelled at and hated or making him very mad at you.

I could be wrong, but thats my opinion.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
I'm Batman.

But that aside, just a general heads up, but trust no one. The means to get the item have been speculated on for since it was discovered, and people have probably figured out the precise and accurate method to doing so. And then lied about it being the precise and accurate method. Trust no one.

Take not their word on if a particular method has worked, for you have no means of determining if they've actually failed to procure the item in question, or if they /have/ procured the item in question and are now partaking in falsehood to propagate the myth of the item while ensuring that it remains available to a limited pool of players.

Trust no one but yourself. Only you can be sure if a method works or does not.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
I actually agree with PW removing stuff from the Ninpo Mask page. It was all speculation and not hard facts (even thought the posters stated that this was merely speculation). However, there is a discussion thread for the Ninpo Mask (not this one) that can be reached from the Ninpo Mask page. That is the place to post theories, rumors, and the like I feel (and, you know, this thread).

So let's hear some theories. I posted this one on the Random board:

My current theory, which I will be slow to test as I have enough on my plate at the moment, is that you need to trigger the effects of every wastelands ally that has a bingo effect (Threads, Palmface, etc.) in one day. Obscure and doable first season (although if it's suppose to be difficult in season 1, that's probably not it). Just to be 'safe' do the bingos on Ascended Kaijukage.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded: I've been told it doesn't require player interaction.So bingos are out then? And remember, the item's old, the way it's gotten was changed after Wasteland was introduced.So no Mono/BN content either.It can't be gotten from a mission, WhiteEye would know.What else is there, special missions?

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded: So maybe you bingo somebody that as a full moon during dark hour.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
The Mask is obtained through Bingo-ing. You get the mask based on who you bingo and when you bingo them.

Of course, you can't just bingo ANYBODY and get the mask, the person you Bingo has to be SOMEBODY. As for the when, well, that changes on a regular basis.

The reason I removed it was simple Rumors do not have a Place on a wiki page it is for facts not rumor once you confirm something feel free to add it at your own risk you'd be surprised at how many people were fighting over this item but since it has been nerfed and at this point might or might not even Loop anymore I could really care less about it at this time.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded: At least its nice to know that not any brand new player can just go get the item. Its for the players that dont give up on bvs after a few weeks. I have no intention on telling anyone how to get it but trust me. when you find out how to get it you too most likely will want to keep its secret.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
All the curiosity is nice, but two points:

1.) Everyone dodging a bingo 20% of the time? There's enough RNG hate as it is. I'd gladly give up that item to ensure that half of BvS's playerbase doesn't have it. Given, when that time comes, there's a chance McM would nerf it, but until that happens, I wouldn't assume it will.

2.) In time, everyone will eventually figure out how to get this item. It'll just take until enough people figure it out that it's no longer worth keeping a secret. Or until someone who has it decides to tell people. All the secrecy is doing is delaying the inevitible.

So, everyone really has 2 choices. You can either try a bunch of stuff until you get it. Or you can accept that you won't get it immediately and just wait a month or two, or possibly longer depending on how obscure the item stays, and half of BvS will know how to get it.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
Assuming that your hypothetical small group of players exists (it probably does), it is not their place, nor anyone's except McMasters, to dictate what information should be given out. This is a bleeding Wiki for crying out loud.

And if the mask's commonality becomes a problem, McMasters will nerf it. Or make it give you lollipops at dayroll or something.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
Or people just don't want it to be widespread. Any decent s3 jonin can get the Ninpo mask. It's not that hard once you know how. And can you imagine the entire BvS population with a 20% immunity to bingos?
This is also yet another way to test how much the RNG hates you; How many times does Ninpo Mask consecutively block your bingo?

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
Quoteing Portalwizard's original post for reference. Spacing was changed to get it in one quote but otherwise it's a direct CnP.

as of this moment if anyone has info on this Item and reply's to this be ready to take what you have coming for warned. P.S not me that will bother you but plenty that would

You see what he did there. He didn't say, "I will sabomelt your village into slag!" He didn't say, "I will bingo you… hard!" He didn't even say, "I won't be your friend anymore." He said, something, might happen, sometime, from someone, maybe. Heck, with a threat, and I use the word in the loosest sense possible, that vague McMasters might give you a shiny for revealing it.

Or looking at it the other way, if you reveal it, and nothing untoward happens to you, well PW (can I call you PW, or will might something bad happen to me?) did say maybe. I have never had anyone threaten me who was so concerned about covering his own ass.

You know, I really wish that I had any info on this item to share, mostly because I love threats. Threats bring out the very best in people.

Frankly, the only person who's threats you should be worried about are McMasters, and that's because we want to cause him as little grief as possible. If it says in the item description or something not to reveal how I got it (assuming I even know how I did it in the first place), then I would honor it. But not because someone with delusions of adequacy made some vague reference to possible consequences.

item.title: Re: Ninpo mask
item.content:encoded:
1/5 chance of not being bingoed is something every village leader would love, especially if they're ascendant. it could even be a 1/100 chance and it would still be worth it, since it means their village is that much harder to invade. it's like an unlimited supply of unreliable reversing hourglasses that costs no appetite.

even if it did nothing at all, people will want it, simply because it's something to collect in a game they enjoy playing.
